starTrek.geometry

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • starTrek.geometry.Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class, meant to hold the necessary values to define a straight line in a 2 dimensional space
    Author:
    Mauro Moltrasio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line()
      The default constructor generates a straight line along the X axis
      Line(java.lang.Double gradient, java.lang.Double intercept)
      Sets the lines parameters from the given arguments.
      Line(java.lang.Double x1, java.lang.Double y1, java.lang.Double x2, java.lang.Double y2)
      Calculates and sets the gradient and intercept of this line based on two dots in the plain.

      Checks whether a given point is inside this line Before doing the actual check and taking into account the application for this class is in a planetary scale, where the integer value is in the order of thousands of kilometers, we will round position values to integers and drop the decimals.

      • containsPoint

        public boolean containsPoint(java.lang.Double xPos,
                             java.lang.Double yPos)
        Checks whether a given point is inside this line

        Before doing the actual check and taking into account the application for this class is in a planetary scale, where the integer value is in the order of thousands of kilometers, we will round position values to integers and drop the decimals. Because of this, the alignment of planets wont be perfect, but then again, planets are big and our model just assumes they are dots so it will balance itself out.

        Parameters:
        xPos - the position of the point along the x axis
        yPos - the position of the point along the y axis
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the line
